name: Federal Republic of Germany
description: German employment law provides strong worker protections through statutory requirements and collective agreements

employmentType.rule: Employment contracts should be in writing. Fixed-term contracts are limited to 2 years maximum without objective justification.
employmentType.exceptions: Fixed-term contracts can exceed 2 years with objective reasons (project work, replacement).

minimumWage.rule: Statutory minimum wage is €12.41 per hour (as of 2024). Must be clearly stated in employment contract.
minimumWage.exceptions: Collective agreements may set different rates. Internships and certain training positions may be exempt.

vacation.rule: Minimum 20 working days paid annual leave for 5-day work week (Bundesurlaubsgesetz). Most employers provide 25-30 days.
vacation.exceptions: Collective agreements often provide more. Unused vacation generally cannot be forfeited.

workingHours.rule: Maximum 8 hours per day, up to 48 hours per week (Arbeitszeitgesetz). Can extend to 10 hours if average stays at 8 over 6 months.
workingHours.exceptions: On-call arrangements and certain sectors have specific rules. Minimum 11 hours rest between shifts.

overtime.rule: Overtime compensation must be specified in contract - either paid or compensated with time off.
overtime.exceptions: Senior executives (leitende Angestellte) may have different arrangements.

terminationNotice.rule: Statutory notice periods based on tenure: 4 weeks basic, increasing to 7 months after 20 years (§622 BGB).
terminationNotice.exceptions: Probation period (max 6 months) allows 2-week notice. Termination for cause (wichtiger Grund) allows immediate termination.

terminationProtection.rule: Kündigungsschutzgesetz applies to employers with 10+ employees. Termination requires valid reason (operational, personal, or conduct-related).
terminationProtection.exceptions: Probation period employees and small businesses exempt. Works council must be consulted before termination.

sickLeave.rule: Employer pays 100% salary for first 6 weeks of illness (Entgeltfortzahlung). Health insurance covers 70% of salary after.
sickLeave.exceptions: Doctor's certificate (Arbeitsunfähigkeitsbescheinigung) required from day 1 or 4 based on company policy.

parentalLeave.rule: Each parent entitled to up to 3 years parental leave (Elternzeit) per child, with job protection.
parentalLeave.exceptions: Can be taken flexibly until child is 8 years old. Parental allowance (Elterngeld) provides partial income replacement.

worksCouncil.rule: Employees have right to form works council (Betriebsrat) in companies with 5+ employees. Must be informed on key decisions.
worksCouncil.exceptions: Management-level employees (leitende Angestellte) have their own representation (Sprecherausschuss).

dataPrivacy.rule: GDPR and BDSG apply. Employee consent for data processing required for non-essential matters. Data minimization principle applies.
dataPrivacy.exceptions: Data processing for employment relationship performance does not require consent.

nonCompete.rule: Non-compete clauses require compensation of at least 50% of last salary during restriction period. Maximum 2 years duration.
nonCompete.exceptions: Employer can waive non-compete with 1 year notice. Void if employee was terminated for employer's cause.
